item.title: Andrew Roth on Twitter
item.description:
Andrew Roth on Twitter

“Contact queuing on the Kazakh border for the second day says that locals have a business where they get two cars in the queue and then let people cut in between them. Selling spots for $500 and can do as many as they want. “So you get why I’ve been here two days,” he says.”

URL: https://mobile.twitter.com/Andrew__Roth/status/1574736530371153924

item.title: Jacques Dreze has passed away
item.description:
Kaushik Basu on Twitter

“Just got news of Prof. Jacques Dreze’s passing. He was one of the greatest economic theorists, & a noble & kind human being. I first met him in the early 80s when he lectured at the Delhi School of Economics. He was one of my big influences. Will miss him greatly.”

URL: https://twitter.com/kaushikcbasu/status/1574076151185768448

source: Monday assorted links

item.title: Adept
item.description:
Adept on Twitter

“1/7 We built a new model! It’s called Action Transformer (ACT-1) and we taught it to use a bunch of software tools. In this first video, the user simply types a high-level request and ACT-1 does the rest. Read on to see more examples ⬇️”

URL: https://twitter.com/AdeptAILabs/status/1570144499187453952

source: Best of Twitter - September 12-25, 2022

item.title: Erik Hoel
item.description:
Erik Hoel on Twitter

“2. The lesser-known cousin to Fermi’s Paradox (“Where are all the aliens?”), the Sapient Paradox asks “Why were we stuck in prehistory?” Ritual mammoth houses made of bones are some of the earliest structures at 15,000 BC. Göbekli Tepe is 9,000 BC! Where’d ~190,000 years go??”

URL: https://twitter.com/erikphoel/status/1567153092986109955

source: Best of Twitter - September 12-25, 2022

item.title: Erik Hoel
item.description:
Erik Hoel on Twitter

“22. So maybe the Sapient Paradox is because we were in a “gossip trap” of raw social power, and everything went to reputation management, and humans lived in separate “high schools” for hundreds of thousands of years until forced to invent civilization by Dunbar’s number”

URL: https://twitter.com/erikphoel/status/1567161851984633856

source: Best of Twitter - September 12-25, 2022
